qas.question: What troops were stationed along the Tajik-African border?
French troops have been stationed at the Dushanbe Airport since before what attacks?
The Government of China rebuilt the Ayni what?
What is the main base of the Taliban air force?
There have been talks with Romania concerning use of what?

context: <a0_0><b4_0>Russian border troops<b4_0/><a0_0/> were stationed along the Tajik–Afghan border until summer 2005. Since <b5_0>the September 11, 2001 attacks<b5_0/>, French troops have been stationed <a1_0>at the Dushanbe Airport<a1_0/> in support of air operations of NATO's International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan. United States Army and Marine Corps personnel periodically visit Tajikistan <a2_0>to conduct joint training missions of up to several weeks duration.<a2_0/> The Government of India rebuilt <b7_0>the Ayni <b6_0>Air Base<b7_0/><b6_0/>, a military airpor<a3_0>t located 15 km southwest of Dushanbe<a3_0/>, at a cost of $70 million, completing the repairs in September 2010. It is now the main base of the Tajikistan air force. There have been talks with Russia concerning use of <b8_0>the Ayni facility<b8_0/>, and Russia continues to maintain a large base on the outskirts of Dushanbe.
